theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation and SASP-mediated inflammation causing tissue dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on increased p53 activity driving senescence, apoptosis, and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes epigenetic changes, histone modifications, chromatin remodeling sustaining senescence and SASP.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CD36-mediated activation of Src-p38-NF-κB signaling initiating SASP and reinforcing senescence.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes irreversible cell cycle arrest, SASP secretion, and senescent cell accumulation linked to aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage response, stable arrest, SASP secretion, and chromatin/epigenetic alterations in senescence.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic and epigenetic regulation of senescence, SASP secretion, and dual role in cancer and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and causal role in bone aging and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Apoptosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on PEDF regulation modulating p53 and SASP, influencing cell cycle arrest and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Calcium Signaling-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ITPR2-mediated ER-mitochondria calcium flux increasing mitochondrial ROS, activating p53 and NF-κB to induce senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Reprogramming and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic changes in senescent cells, SASP secretion, and cell cycle arrest pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA repair deficiency causing DNA damage accumulation, senescence, SASP, apoptosis, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as irreversible arrest with SASP secretion, immune clearance decline, and aging contribution.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated and Oxidative Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence via Hayflick limit, telomere shortening, and senescent T cell accumulation.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes programmed senescence, SASP secretion, immune system clearance of senescent cells, and immune aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in diabetic CKD and vascular aging with SASP-mediated inflammation and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extracellular vesicle SASP activating NF-κB/IKK signaling to induce paracrine senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and modulation of aging phenotypes via senescence pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on irreversible growth arrest, SASP secretion, p53/p16 pathways, and senescent cell accumulation with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes permanent growth arrest, SASP secretion, accumulation with age, and dual role in tissue repair and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Apoptosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses balance of apoptosis and senescence, genetic modulation of apoptosis, and their roles in aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Remodeling and SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cellular senescence to impaired reprogramming, highlighting DNA damage, telomere attrition, and epigenetic alterations.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic regulation in stem cell senescence, linking metabolism, epigenetics, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: RNA Sensing and Innate Immunity-Driven Endothelial Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes self-RNA accumulation activating RIG-I sensor, inducing interferon-like response and SASP in endothelial senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sphingolipid-Mediated Cellular Senescence and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on sphingolipid balance (ceramide and S1P) regulating senescence induction, SASP secretion, and aging effects.
